segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, her mind seemingly elsewhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing, creating a puddle that's slowly taking over the kitchen floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be exhausted or distracted to not notice the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the children, their eyes locked on the cookie jar, determined to get their prize.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pang of anxiety as I watch the boy struggle to keep his balance on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl, her hand reaching up, ready to catch any cookies that come her way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they're quite the pair, those two, always up to something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the garden outside, a stark contrast to the chaos unfolding inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like a little slice of heaven, just beyond the kitchen window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman wakes up from her daze and the children get their cookies without any accidents.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what's going through their minds, if they're aware of the danger or just focused on the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR
